newsitem.title: USA: Computer Integration reversing charge in Q2.
newsitem.headline: Computer Integration reversing charge in Q2.

text.p: Computer Integration Corp said on Tuesday that it has decided not to proceed with plans to relocate its headquarters, leading it to reverse a significant portion of a $2.3 million pre-tax charge in the second quarter.

Computer Integration, a reseller of microcomputers, workstations and related products, said in a statement that it decided not to move its headquarters and distribution facilities to Atlanta because it wanted to keep "certain key executives for whom relocation was not a viable option."
Instead, it plans to consolidate those functions into existing facilities in Boston and in Charlotte, N.C.
The charge was recorded in the fourth quarter of the 1996 fiscal year. It plans to recognize the gain from the reversal in the 1997 fiscal year's second quarter ending December 31.
The Boca Raton headquarters will be closed and its operations moved to Boston during the 1997 third quarter, the company said.
